TextBody:
Hello atif,

I wanted to check in regarding your support ticket 00436938. We haven’t heard from you in a while, and I just wanted to see if you still need assistance with this issue.

If you’re still experiencing problems or have any updates to share, please let me know. If the issue has been resolved, I can go ahead and close the ticket on my end.

Please feel free to reply to this email with any updates or questions. We’re here to help you get the most out of your Netwrix products.

Ticket Number: 00436938
Ticket Subject: Hardened Paths have been modified to lower the security level
Ticket Details: Hi,I would like to schedule a meeting to discuss the following risk identified by Pingcastle: Hardened Paths have been modified to lower the security level.The agenda for the meeting would be to review and discuss how to remediate this risk from our AD.Please let me know your availability for Thursday 27th February.Kind Regards,Atif Rashid

Thank you!

Iulia Apatachioaei
Sr. Support Engineer
____________________ _________
Powerful Data Security Made Easy

300 Spectrum Ctr Dr #200, Irvine, CA 92618
www.netwrix.com


--------------- Original Message ---------------
From: Netwrix Support [techsupport@netwrix.com]
Sent: 3/3/2025 5:51 AM
To: atif.rashid@barrattplc.co.uk
Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #436938 - - *EXTERNAL:Hardened Paths have been modified to lower the security level [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0MHjIe:ref ]

Dear Atif,

Following up on our meeting, I am providing further details regarding the findings related to Hardened UNC Paths and Protected Users, along with the recommended mitigation steps.

	Hardened Paths Have Been Modified to Lower the Security Level

This finding indicates that the Hardened UNC Paths policy has been altered, reducing protection for SYSVOL and NETLOGON shares. This increases the risk of unauthorized access and potential manipulation of Group Policy settings.

-To mitigate this, the policy should be correctly enforced through Group Policy Management:
Navigate to Computer Configuration > Policies > Administrative Templates > Network > Network Provider > Hardened UNC Paths
-Apply the following values:
\*SYSVOL  RequireMutualAuthentication=1, RequireIntegrity=1  
\*NETLOGON  RequireMutualAuthentication=1, RequireIntegrity=1  
-Run gpupdate /force and verify access controls.

	Number of Users Not in Protected Users

The Protected Users group enhances security by enforcing stricter authentication policies, preventing NTLM usage, and restricting credential caching. Users not in this group remain more susceptible to authentication-based attacks.

To mitigate this, privileged accounts should be added to the Protected Users group:
-Open Active Directory Users and Computers (ADUC)
-Locate and modify the Protected Users group
-Add the necessary accounts and enforce a Group Policy update

Please let me know if you need any further clarification in implementing these changes.

Best regards,
Iulia Apatachioaei
Sr. Support Engineer
____________________ _________
Powerful Data Security Made Easy

300 Spectrum Ctr Dr #200, Irvine, CA 92618
www.netwrix.com

Dear Atif, Thank you for reaching out regarding the risk identified by PingCastle related to "Hardened Paths being modified to lower the security level. " Ahead of our meeting, I’m sharing the relevant Microsoft support article



 


Dear Atif,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the risk identified by PingCastle related to "Hardened Paths being modified to lower the security level."

Ahead of our meeting, I’m sharing the relevant Microsoft support article  here . The section on "Minimum recommended configuration for domain-joined computers" provides guidance on properly securing Group Policy paths, which is the focus of PingCastle’s detection.

I am available to meet on Thursday between 10:00 AM CET and 6:00 PM CET. Please let me know the most suitable time for you.

Looking forward to your confirmation.

Best regards,
Iulia Apatachioaei
Sr. Support Engineer

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #436938 - - *EXTERNAL:Hardened Paths have been modified to lower the security level [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0MHjIe:ref ]

Dear Atif,

Following up on our meeting, I am providing further details regarding the findings related to Hardened UNC Paths and Protected Users, along with the recommended mitigation steps.

  *   Hardened Paths Have Been Modified to Lower the Security Level
This finding indicates that the Hardened UNC Paths policy has been altered, reducing protection for SYSVOL and NETLOGON shares. This increases the risk of unauthorized access and potential manipulation of Group Policy settings.

-To mitigate this, the policy should be correctly enforced through Group Policy Management:
Navigate to Computer Configuration > Policies > Administrative Templates > Network > Network Provider > Hardened UNC Paths
-Apply the following values:
\*SYSVOL<file://*/SYSVOL>  RequireMutualAuthentication=1, RequireIntegrity=1
\*NETLOGON<file://*/NETLOGON>  RequireMutualAuthentication=1, RequireIntegrity=1
-Run gpupdate /force and verify access controls.

  *   Number of Users Not in Protected Users
The Protected Users group enhances security by enforcing stricter authentication policies, preventing NTLM usage, and restricting credential caching. Users not in this group remain more susceptible to authentication-based attacks.

To mitigate this, privileged accounts should be added to the Protected Users group:
-Open Active Directory Users and Computers (ADUC)
-Locate and modify the Protected Users group
-Add the necessary accounts and enforce a Group Policy update

Please let me know if you need any further clarification in implementing these changes.

Best regards,
Iulia Apatachioaei
Sr. Support Engineer

--------------- Original Message ---------------
From: Netwrix Support [techsupport@netwrix.com]
Sent: 3/3/2025 5:51 AM
To: atif.rashid@barrattplc.co.uk
Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #436938 - - *EXTERNAL:Hardened Paths have been modified to lower the security level [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0MHjIe:ref ]

Dear Atif,

Following up on our meeting, I am providing further details regarding the findings related to Hardened UNC Paths and Protected Users, along with the recommended mitigation steps.


	Hardened Paths Have Been Modified to Lower the Security Level


This finding indicates that the Hardened UNC Paths policy has been altered, reducing protection for SYSVOL and NETLOGON shares. This increases the risk of unauthorized access and potential manipulation of Group Policy settings.

-To mitigate this, the policy should be correctly enforced through Group Policy Management:
Navigate to Computer Configuration > Policies > Administrative Templates > Network > Network Provider > Hardened UNC Paths
-Apply the following values:
\*SYSVOL  RequireMutualAuthentication=1, RequireIntegrity=1  
\*NETLOGON  RequireMutualAuthentication=1, RequireIntegrity=1  
-Run gpupdate /force and verify access controls.


	Number of Users Not in Protected Users


The Protected Users group enhances security by enforcing stricter authentication policies, preventing NTLM usage, and restricting credential caching. Users not in this group remain more susceptible to authentication-based attacks.

To mitigate this, privileged accounts should be added to the Protected Users group:
-Open Active Directory Users and Computers (ADUC)
-Locate and modify the Protected Users group
-Add the necessary accounts and enforce a Group Policy update

Please let me know if you need any further clarification in implementing these changes.

Best regards,
Iulia Apatachioaei
Sr. Support Engineer
____________________ _________
Powerful Data Security Made Easy

300 Spectrum Ctr Dr #200, Irvine, CA 92618
www.netwrix.com
